definition: grain/granule/classifier for small round things (peas, bullets, peanuts, pills, grains etc)

sentences.english: The hen ate the grains of corn on the ground.
The heavier parts of the grain will settle to the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 稍重些的谷粒都沉在底下。

sentences.english: The full-grain leather upper is perforated for comfort and breathability .
sentences.chinese: 采用全谷粒皮革鞋面，穿孔，舒适透气。

sentences.english: This study employed sorghum grain as raw material for ethanol production using an commercial active dry yeast.
sentences.chinese: 本实验以高梁谷粒为原料，进行酒精发酵的研究。

sentences.english: Barley and brown rice, which is the traditional Chinese medicine in both malt and grain flavor.
sentences.chinese: 大麦和玄米，也就是中药里的麦芽和谷粒两味。

sentences.english: Hold like rich garners the full ripened grain;
sentences.chinese: 没能像殷实的谷仓储藏着饱满的谷粒。

sentences.english: Grain yield is heavily influenced by the architecture of the inflorescence .
sentences.chinese: 花序的构型严重影响谷粒生产量。

definition: ear of grain/gerbe (used on coats of arms)
grain not fully grown/husks/withered grain/unripe grain
variant of 包穀|包谷[bao1 gu3]
husk/(of a radish etc) spongy (and therefore unappetising)
(dialect) maize/corn/also written 苞穀|苞谷[bao1 gu3]
